channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ukrainian president to meet with EU leaders as they make decision on war funding
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with European Union leaders Thursday as they prepare massive new financing for Kyiv's war effort.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with European Union leaders Thursday as they prepare massive new financing for Kyiv's war effort.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: Trump wants to end the war in Ukraine. Does he have any influence over Putin?
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Washington Post columnist David Ignatius about what influence President Trump wields with Russian President Vladimir Putin on ending the war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Washington Post columnist David Ignatius about what influence President Trump wields with Russian President Vladimir Putin on ending the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: International Court of Justice says Israel must allow UN aid into Gaza
item.description: The International Court of Justice has ruled that Israel must allow UN aid into Gaza and allow them to operate without interference. But Israel has rejected the non-binding opinion.
item.content:encoded: The International Court of Justice has ruled that Israel must allow UN aid into Gaza and allow them to operate without interference. But Israel has rejected the non-binding opinion.
item.dc:creator: Anna Holligan

item.title: Sports ticket prices are getting more expensive — and pricing out many fans
item.description: For sports fans, there's nothing as exciting as going to see your team play. But what was once an affordable form of entertainment is becoming increasingly more expensive and pricing some loyal fans out.
item.content:encoded:
For sports fans, there's nothing as exciting as going to see your team play. But what was once an affordable form of entertainment is becoming increasingly more expensive and pricing some loyal fans out.

(Image credit: Getty Images and via Bob Hinz)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: Confused by the legal battles over troop deployments? Here's what to know
item.description: Two significant legal actions — including a possible decision from the U.S. Supreme Court — are expected this week. While both would be preliminary, they could impact how courts weigh in on such cases going forward.
item.content:encoded:
Two significant legal actions — including a possible decision from the U.S. Supreme Court — are expected this week. While both would be preliminary, they could impact how courts weigh in on such cases going forward.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Ukraine's president to meet with EU leaders Thursday, decisions could be made this week in legal battles around Trump's National Guard deployments, the Pentagon press corps gets a right-wing makeover.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine's president to meet with EU leaders Thursday, decisions could be made this week in legal battles around Trump's National Guard deployments, the Pentagon press corps gets a right-wing makeover.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: University of Virginia makes deal with Trump administration to halt investigations
item.description: The University of Virginia has reached a deal with the Trump administration to pause ongoing civil rights investigations. It's the third college to do so, but unlike the others, it won't pay anything.
item.content:encoded: The University of Virginia has reached a deal with the Trump administration to pause ongoing civil rights investigations. It's the third college to do so, but unlike the others, it won't pay anything.
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: 'It's really a political problem': Ray Dalio on the U.S. debt crisis
item.description: The U.S. debt has reached $37 trillion. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with billionaire and hedge fund manager Ray Dalio about the ramifications of the debt crisis.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. debt has reached $37 trillion. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with billionaire and hedge fund manager Ray Dalio about the ramifications of the debt crisis.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Murder trial underway for Illinois sheriff deputy who killed unarmed Black woman
item.description: Last year, Sonya Massey, an unarmed Black woman, was killed by a deputy sheriff in her Illinois home after calling 911 for help. The trial for that former officer continues Thursday.
item.content:encoded: Last year, Sonya Massey, an unarmed Black woman, was killed by a deputy sheriff in her Illinois home after calling 911 for help. The trial for that former officer continues Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Mawa Iqbal

item.title: How Russia's shadow fleet of oil tankers evades western sanctions
item.description: The U.S. and other western countries have issued sanctions on Russian oil exports since 2022. The Planet Money team explains how the country's shadow fleet of aging oil tankers evades policing.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. and other western countries have issued sanctions on Russian oil exports since 2022. The Planet Money team explains how the country's shadow fleet of aging oil tankers evades policing.
item.dc:creator: Alexi Horowitz-Ghazi
